title: CBT Nuggets - CCNP Data Center DCUFI 642-997
description:
Cisco CCNP Data Center 642-997 DCUFI by Anthony Sequeira
Implementing Cisco Data Center Unified Fabric <a href="
https://www.cbtnuggets.com/it-training-videos/course/csco_642_997" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
https://www.cbtnuggets.com/it-training-videos/course/csco_642_997</a>


In this incredibly in-depth CBT Nuggets course, CBT Nuggets trainer Anthony Sequeira guides students through the implementation of Cisco Unified Fabric technologies. This includes a detailed examination of Cisco Nexus switches and Cisco MDS storage products.

Recommended skills:
Familiarity with the Cisco Internetwork Operating System (IOS)

Recommended equipment:
While no specific equipment is required to enjoy the course, practice Nexus and MDS devices would benefit the student.

Related certifications: Cisco CCNP Data Center, Cisco CCIE Data Center


From the smallest organizations to the very largest, Cisco Data Center inventions are joining standards-based technologies to revolutionize the Information Technology (IT) industry. This course is critical for any engineer or designer that is interested in the future of network computing. Specifically, this course focuses on the Nexus and MDS equipment from Cisco Systems, and the technologies that make a unified fabric of LAN and SAN traffic possible. Some of the industry-hottest technologies are thoroughly explored including OTV, vPC, LISP, VM-FEX, and Cisco FabricPath (TRILL). This course is a perfect follow up from the CCNA Data Center courses here at CBT Nuggets, as well as the Cisco UCS courses.


Content:
01 - Intro
02 - Overview and Data Center Architectures
03 - The Nexus 7K Product Family
04 - PRACTICAL: Exploring the 7K
05 - Other Nexus Devices
06 - Introducing the NX-OS
07 - PRACTICAL: Initial Setup of the 5K
08 - IOS In-Service Software Upgrade (ISSU)
09 - System Level High Availability
10 - Virtual Device Contexts
11 - Virtual Device Context Configuration
12 - Basic Interface Parameters
13 - Configuring FEX
14 - Adapter FEX
15 - VLANs, VXLANS, and Private VLANs
16 - RSTP, MSTP, and STP Extensions
17 - Port Channels and Virtual Port Channels
18 - Configuring Port Channels and vPCs
19 - Port Channels and FEX
20 - PRACTICAL: FEX, PCs and vPCs
21 - Cisco FabricPath
22 - Configuring FabricPath
23 - PRACTICAL: FabricPath
24 - Routing Protocol Configurations
25 - Graceful Restart
26 - FHRPs
27 - Policy Based Routing (PBR)
28 - Multicast
29 - Overlay Transport Virtualization (OTV)
30 - Locator-ID Separation Protocol (LISP)
31 - Nexus Security Features
32 - Fibre Channel (FC)
33 - Fibre Channel over Ethernet (FCoE)
34 - Data Center Bridging (DCB) Enhancements
35 - Configuring SAN Technologies
36 - PRACTICAL: Initial Setup of the MDS
37 - User Management
38 - Virtualization and the Unified Fabric
39 - Cisco Fabric Services
